defence.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the act of protecting something or someone from attack
defence.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: a firm commitment to the defense of human rights
The first line of defence is a smoke detector.
In Britain, the defence of the country has historically been left to the navy.
defence.translation[0].definitions[1].de: something that can be used to protect something or someone from attack
defence.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The area’s flood defences need repair.
The immune system is the body’s defence against infection.
defence.translation[0].definitions[2].de: all the systems, people, materials etc that a country uses to protect itself from attack
defence.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: calls for a national debate on defence
defence.translation[0].definitions[3].de: all the armies, weapons, structures etc that are available to defend a place
defence.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: The invading army easily overcame the town’s defences.
defence.translation[0].definitions[4].de: something that you say or do in order to support someone or something that is being criticized
defence.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: Evelyn Waugh came to Wilson’s defence and acknowledged the brilliance of the book’s themes.
Jean wrote a letter to the paper in Angela’s defense.
defence.translation[0].definitions[5].de: the things that are said in a court of law to prove that someone is not guilty of a crime
defence.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: Major has a good defence and believes he will win the case.
defence.translation[0].definitions[6].de: all the lawyers who try to prove in a court of law that someone is not guilty of a crime
defence.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: The defense called only one witness.
defence.translation[0].definitions[7].de: something you do or a way of behaving that prevents you from seeming weak or being hurt by others
defence.translation[0].definitions[7].ex: Liz dropped her defences and began to relax.
defence.translation[0].definitions[8].de: the players on a sports team whose main job is to try to prevent the other team from getting points
defence.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: The country's defence forces are on standby in case of an attack.
Is the national defence system adequate?
Ministers in Brussels have been discussing a possible European defence policy.
There were plans to cut defence spending by one billion pounds.
They have called for the defence budget to be increased.
This is secret information, known only to the Defence Department.
The Defence Secretary is under pressure to resign.
defence.translation[1].definitions[0].de: the things that are said in a court of law to try to prove that someone is not guilty of a crime
defence.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: I am unhappy about the way my barrister is conducting my defence.
defence.translation[1].definitions[1].de: the lawyers in a court of law who try to prove that someone is not guilty of a crime
defence.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: the chief witness for the defence
The defense argued that the case should be dropped.
defence.translation[1].definitions[2].de: actions taken by a company to prevent a takeover that it does not want
